clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High-intensity Training on the Level of Physical Activity After Thoracoscopy Surgery: a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of High-intensity Training on the Level of Physical Activity After Thoracoscopy Surgery: a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Goal of this study is to evaluate management with high intensity re-entrainment during the postoperative hospital phase.
This type of early treatment with as little intervention time has so far never been done. The investigators therefore want to carry out this feasibility study in order to collect the data needed to calculate the number of randomized control trial. Investigators will also evaluate the feasibility of this project concerning recruitment, intervention in the hospital phase and data collection once the return home. The evaluation of the activity will be done one month after the return to home by means of a actigraphy of one week.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: feasibility Study with randomized control trial

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the impact of the intervention on the level of physical activity when returning home by actigraphy
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline number of steps at 7 days after back home and at 30 days after back home
primary_outcome.description: Number of steps per day during 5 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the impact of the intervention on the level of physical activity by questionnaires.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline questionnaire at 7 days after back home and at 30 days after back home

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the impact of the intervention on the level of physical activity by questionnaires.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline questionnaire at 7 days after back home and at 30 days after back home

intervention.description: Cyclo-ergometer session in high intensity setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Indication of thoracoscopic surgery
- Autonomous mobilization (with or without auxiliary device)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient dependent on oxygen before the procedure
- chronic obstructive pulmonary disease patient with forced expiratory volume at one second <50% predicted
